title: 6 pC particle set - E field from V-of-x equation

content.question: From further observations of the particle’s motion, it is determined that the electric potential can be modeled by the equation <math alttext="V of x equals, A times open parenthesis, x minus B, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> are positive constants. What is the electric field?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 A times open parenthesis, x minus B, close parenthesis, i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>

<math alttext="negative 2 A times open parenthesis, x minus B, close parenthesis, i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>

<math alttext="the fraction A over 3, end fraction, times open parenthesis, x minus B, close parenthesis, cubed, i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>A</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></msup><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>

<math alttext="the negative fraction A over 3, end fraction, times open parenthesis, x minus B, close parenthesis, cubed, i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>A</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></msup><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative 2 A times open parenthesis, x minus B, close parenthesis, i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
